lead_paragraph: The judges weighed 10,292 options and the country spent two years thinking about it, but in the end the vote was decisively for the century-old ensign.

headline.print_headline: In Flag Vote, Union Jack Beats the Silver Fern
headline.main: New Zealand, Unmoved by Bionic Kiwi and Starry-Eyed Sheep, Keeps Its Flag

snippet: The judges weighed 10,292 options and the country spent two years thinking about it, but in the end the vote was decisively for the century-old ensign.
abstract: Majority of New Zealanders vote to keep nation's current flag, after two-year process during which over ten thousand new designs were considered; Prime Min John Key had advocated replacement for flag some consider too closely tied to colonial past.
